column1: git fetch : Fetches changes from a remote repository without merging them.
git rebase: Applies changes from one branch onto another by rewinding and replaying commits.
git tag: Creates or lists tags (labels) for a specific commit or branch.
git blame: Shows who made each change to a file and when.
git cherry-pick: Applies a specific commit from one branch onto another.
git revert: Reverts a commit by creating a new commit that undoes the changes made by the original commit.
git submodule: Manages submodules
column2: which are separate Git repositories that are included within a parent repository.

column1: git show: Displays the contents of a specific commit or object.
git remote add: Adds a new remote repository to the local repository.
git remote rm: Removes a remote repository from the local repository.
git push --force: Forces a push to a remote repository
column2: overwriting any changes that may have been made.

column1: git config: Sets or displays configuration options for Git.
git clean: Deletes untracked files from the working directory.
git log --graph: Displays a graphical representation of the commit history.
git bisect: Helps to find the commit that introduced a bug by performing a binary search through the commit history.git branch -d: Deletes a specific branch.
git branch -r: Lists remote branches for a specific repository.
git checkout -b: Creates a new branch and switches to it.
git fetch --prune: Removes any tracking references to remote branches that have been deleted on the remote repository.
git log --oneline: Displays the commit history in a condensed format.
git reflog: Displays a log of all references (e.g. branches
column2: tags) that have been updated in the repository.

column1: git show-branch: Displays the branch and tag labels for each commit in the commit history.
git submodule update: Updates the submodules of a parent repository to the latest commit of their respective branches.
git stash apply: Applies the most recent stash to the working directory.
git commit --amend: Modifies the most recent commit to include additional changes.
git cherry: Shows the commits that have been made on one branch but not on another.
git grep: Searches for a specific pattern in the contents of files in the repository.
git log --author: Displays the commit history for a specific author.
git rebase -i: Allows interactive rebase
column4: squash or reorder commits in the history.

column1: git blame -L: Shows who made changes to a specific range of lines in a file and when.
